page.title: 02TOURISM IN WOODSTOCK
page.content: Most of the tourists in Woodstock are Americans. In one day, the highest number of people recorded visiting the tourist information office was 57. There are four main reasons why tourists come to visit Woodstock, to see Blenheim Palace, to see the museum on the history of Oxfordshire, to see the shops and to see the beautiful scenes of the town. The tourist information office is open all through the summer. It provides many things- leaflets, guide books, maps, bus time-tables, bus routes and lots of information on the town. There are two bus services which run through Woodstock- Worths, which goes from Woodstock to Oxford, the South Midlands Service, which takes the same route. There is an open-topped bus for a scenic drive to Blenheim.
